newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Adelaide Brighton sees no abnormal losses.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Adelaide Brighton sees no abnormal losses.

text.p: Adelaide Brighton Ltd said on Thursday it was not expecting to record any abnormal losses in 1996/97 to June 30 and anticipated a modest growth through efficiencies in its net profit.

"We are not expecting any abnormals," new managing director Richard Hammond told reporters when asked about prospects for this financial year. "We will never have, I don't think, as bad a year as we have had (this year)" he said.
"We have never had a situation before where the Australian and Hawaiian markets are down at the same time and that has been a double hit," Hammond said.
Adelaide Brighton earlier reported a net loss of A$49.3 million after abnormal losses of A$62.6 million primarily related to its disasterous Gunpowder copper mine investment.

The company announced that it would sell its investment in the pipe businesses of Humes Industries Ltd in New Zealand and was likely to sell its other New Zealand business, Hurricane Wire Products Ltd.
However, Hammond said the second sale was unlikely in this financial year.
